articles.title: Russia’s Invasion of Ukraine Changed Europe Forever. Here’s How
articles.description: Four years on from Russia’s full-scale invasion, the economic, political and security fallout is reverberating far beyond Ukraine’s borders.

articles.title: Israel deprives Palestinians of proper education by withholding revenues
articles.description: Palestinian education is being destroyed by Israel's policy of withholding Palestinian Authority customs revenues.

articles.title: Waymo is asking DoorDash drivers to shut the doors of its self-driving cars
articles.description: If a passenger accidentally leaves a Waymo door open, the vehicle can get stuck in place.

articles.title: ‘The tears just keep flowing’: child victims of Tumbler Ridge shooting remembered as Carney heads to join vigil
articles.description: Prime minister to meet mourners in mining town as families speak of their loss in one of Canada’s deadliest mass shootingsCanadian prime minister Mark Carney is to join mourners in Tumbler Ridge on Friday, as authorities and relatives released details of the six children and assistant teacher killed

articles.title: New CIA recruitment video targets Chinese military personnel
articles.description: The CIA's latest YouTube video offers instructions for how to contact the agency on the encrypted Tor Browser.

articles.title: PointsBet Faces Canada Suspension in NBA Bet-Rigging Fallout
articles.description: Ontario’s gambling regulator moved to temporarily suspend the registration of PointsBet’s Canadian subsidiary after the online sportsbook allegedly failed to report suspicious wagers related to a 2024 bet-rigging scheme involving a pro basketball player with the Toronto Raptors.

articles.title: Octopus Australia to Spend Over $10 Billion on Green Energy Over Five Years
articles.description: The Australian arm of Octopus Group plans to spend as much as A$20 billion ($14.2 billion) on renewable projects over the next five years, one of the largest investment plans in the country’s green sector.

articles.title: Multiple million dollars in tips still unaccounted for as B.C. restaurants demand answers from app
articles.description: Many hospitality businesses across B.C. are dealing with lost tips as an app that distributes that money is malfunctioning.

articles.title: South Africa’s Ramaphosa says troops will deploy to tackle crime gangs
articles.description: President Cyril Ramaphosa says the military will work with the country's police force to counter 'gang wars'.

articles.title: ‘We now have to figure out how to live life without her’: Mother of Tumbler Ridge shooting victim speaks
articles.description: Sarah Lampert spoke to reporters Thursday night about her daughter, Ticaria, who was among eight people killed in the attack that also left the shooter dead and dozens injured.

articles.title: Survivor of Polytechnique shooting shares experience after Tumbler Ridge tragedy
articles.description: Following the horrific incident in Tumbler Ridge, a prominent survivor of a mass shooting is sharing her experience with grief after traumatic events.

articles.title: Japan says it seized Chinese vessel amid tensions with Beijing
articles.description: The fishing boat tried to flee when ordered to stop for an inspection inside Japan's territorial waters, authorities say.

articles.title: Bangladesh Nationalist Party claims victory in country’s first election since 2024 uprising
articles.description: The Bangladesh Nationalist Party has claimed victory in the country’s first election since the 2024 uprising, positioning itself to form the next government and potentially reshape Bangladesh’s political landscape after years of intense rivalry and disputed polls.

articles.title: US and Taiwan sign ‘pivotal’ deal to cut tariffs
articles.description: Taipei agrees to buy some $85bn of US energy, aircraft and equipment in exchange for 15 percent tariff rate.
